message: You have a gut feeling that it would be better to not go any further unprepared.
You need some item that would help you go through there undiscovered.
The Bridge is broken. It would not hold your weight.
The ground under your feet suddenly gives way, a fissure opens, and you fall into it.

replies.text: Good thing I put on these protective boots. Who knows what could have happened otherwise!

message: Again, a crack has opened and you fall into it.

replies.text: My protective boots saved my life another time!
I almost broke my legs. I wish I had better shoes...

message: Another hole in the ground! This time you can't even see the bottom, but somehow you managed to stop your fall after a few meters.

replies.text: I have to remember to thank Bernhar for the boots!
It is really dangerous to walk here!

message:
Some rocks above your head begin to crack.
A moment later a pile of rocks rains down on you.

replies.text: Thanks to my protective cap I am not seriously hurt.

message:
You hear rocks cracking above your head again.
There is no chance to jump away before they hit!

replies.text: Good thing I am wearing this protective cap!
I should take more care where I am going!

message: You fell into another hole hidden in the ground and hurt yourself.

replies.text: I hope my boots are OK.

message: Rocks falling! You jump aside - luckily a very big boulder only grazed your side.

replies.text: That was neat. I fear that not even my protective cap would have helped much against that huge boulder.

message: A huge boulder suddenly breaks, and its pieces fall down from above onto you.

replies.text: Thanks to my protective cap I am not seriously hurt.

message: You fell into a hole and hurt yourself.

replies.text: Will these holes in the ground never end?

message: Several small but sharp edged pieces of rock are coming down. One hits you right on the top of your head.

replies.text: That could have been very bad without my cap!
Ouch! It's like the mountain is out to get me!

message:
A big part of the mountain side above you cracks.
A moment later a pile of rocks rains down on you.

replies.text: Ouch! It could have been worse though, without the cap!

message: You fell into yet another hole and hurt yourself.

replies.text: Good footwear is a prerequisite for successful exploration!
I'm really starting to hate this place!

message: Guess what - you have found another crack in the ground.

replies.text: [singing] How many holes must a man fall down...?

message:
Seven rocks above your head begin to crack.
A moment later a pile of rocks rains down on you.

replies.text: *Sigh* Even with the protective cap, these rocks are really annoying!

message: You stumble over some rocks. As you fall against the wall, it buckles and the whole wall begins to crumble.
When the dust clears a bit you can see a small corridor.
The ground is very slippery. You can't get back onto the solid rock!
You slide slowly into the cold water ... you think of Mikhail, and of Andor ... your senses disappear ...
Shivering you come back to consciousness. The current has taken you a long way, but fortunately you have been washed ashore.
The lava is bubbling and glowing flakes are scorching through your clothes.
Danger! Unstable cliffs. Proceed with caution!
Danger! Cave subject to rockfall. Do not enter!
Oh - a wandering kid! How surprising!
My name is Bernhar. I am an explorer, and I'm trying to find out something about the cave system here.

replies.text: Ah. Interesting. Keep having fun with it. Bye.

message: Oh - the wandering kid! You are still alive? How surprising!

replies.text: Hi Bernhar. I want to talk with you again.

message: Sure! I could tell you things...
Steep mountain flanks and wide, branching, cave passages! But beware - it is dangerous ground! You must not go unprotected!
You are not taking me seriously. Let me tell you...
You are risking your life here. It is not only those Arulir brutes. They are just annoying.
The ground is really dangerous. It's deceptive and life-threatening. And there is always the danger of falling rocks from above.
I was only able to survive this far because I was wearing the proper protective gear.
I have completed my work here though, so I don't need it any more. I could sell it to you for a good price.
If you go in there unprotected, I fear there will be no other time.
Hey kid! The protective gear is of no use if you don't wear it!

replies.text: Oh, yes. Thank you for reminding me!

message: Oh, what a rare surprise!

replies.text: What are you doing in such a lonely place?
I'm surprised to see you here as well. Did you order 'Mysterious green something'?

message: I am Tjure of Brimhaven. I am ... was ... a successful merchant. But my luck has run out.
All I can do now is hide in this lonely place, far away from any water.

replies.text: Aha. I won't bother you then.

message: I once found a mermaid asleep on the beach of a river, north of here. What a beautiful sight! I could not avert my eyes!
Especially, the colorful tail attracted me so much, that I did something that I have deeply regretted since then.
I pulled out one of her shimmering, dazzling scales, and ran away.
The mermaid immediately awoke and was very angry. But on land she had no chance to catch me.
Crying and sobbing, the mermaid called after me. Finally, she screamed at me that I would never find peace, and that I would never want to approach water again!
At first I was happy with my shimmering scale. But I soon realized that everything in my life was going wrong.
I couldn't think of anything else but the wrath of the people of the river.
What could I do? I tried to throw it away or give it to other people - all in vain.

I traveled all over Dhayavar to find someone to help me. Finally, a wise woman, far in the northeast, listened to my story. She advised me to return the scale to the mermaid. This would break the curse.
But I did not dare to do this.
She told me that my only other option was to find some kind-hearted person to buy it from me, but then they take on the curse.

replies.text: Let me be the one to rescue you. Sell me the scale.

message: I know, I know. When they heard my story, everybody ran away.

replies.text: That's too bad. I hope that you will find someone to buy it. Bye.
Not me. I will buy the scale.

message: So you really won't help me? You will leave me to my misery?

replies.text: Sorry, I can't do it. Bye.
I have to think about it.
OK. maybe I am stupid, but sell me the scale.

message: Here, take it! I have to request gold for it, otherwise it won't work. But one piece of gold should be enough.

replies.text: No problem, here, take the gold.

message: (As soon as you take the scale in your hands, a great sluggishness and a feeling of despair come over you.)
(For a second you feel very dizzy. At least you manage not to faint. As from afar you hear a voice.)
*Sigh* You were my last hope. Leave me now.

replies.text: OK. One question before I go: did you order a 'Mysterious green something'?

message: Thank you for your help.

replies.text: No problem. By the way, did you order a 'Mysterious green something'?

message: Oh, you look better than the last time we met. Thank you for your help.

replies.text: Indeed. By the way, did you order a 'Mysterious green something'?

message: This seems to be a very strange place. Maybe even dangerous.

replies.text: * Put the scale on the ground *

message: What a relief! You suddenly feel lighthearted again.
Suddenly, you hear someone singing.
You never heard such a beautiful sound before.
You found a heavy bag of gold. 1000 shining pieces of gold!
You have found a small, shiny, metal bar.
You feel that you can no longer hold on. You will have to slide into the cold water ...
You think of Mikhail, and of Andor ... your strength is slowly leaving you. ...
Maybe the current will wash you ashore somewhere?
The ground over there is very slippery. You don't want to fall into the water again.
